p: The thermal performances of 2,7-CPI were studied by DMA, TMA, and TGA, which are also compared with those of a typical polyimide (Kapton) and our previous reported structural analogue 2,7-CPPI. The results are listed in Table 1. The 2,7-CPI displayed the highest T g of 467 째C among the three PIs ( Figure 3a). Additionally, the 2,7-CPI possessed outstanding dimensional stability, with a CTE low to 3.4 ppm/K in the range of 100~300 째C ( Figure 3b). Furthermore, the 2,7-CPI exhibited exceptional thermal stability, with T d5% and T d10% of 550 째C and 590 째C, respectively ( Figure S9). The tensile strength and modulus of 2,7-CPI were 134 MPa and 5.7 GPa, respectively. The dimensional and thermal stability and mechanical properties of 2,7-CPI were comparable to those of 2,7-CPPI, but better than Kapton. The excellent thermal and mechanical performances of 2,7-CPI and 2,7-CPPI were mainly attributed to the aromatic rigid carbazole moieties in the PI main chains and the strong interchain cohesion. Also, the 2,7-CPI had good flexibility, which was indicated from the rolled film in Figure S10. The excellent comprehensive performances of 2,7-CPI and 2,7-CPPI make them promising materials in the micro-electronics packaging industry.
